intro: Actinoseris polymorpha, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant has a succulent, branching stem and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments with minimal water, featuring thick leaves and a deep root system. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for xeriscaping in drought-prone areas.
